channel.title: Algorithms on Neil
channel.description: Recent content in Algorithms on Neil

item.title: paxos digest
item.description:
Paxos

Paxos is one of the most important algorithms in distributed system.[1] Here are some notes about Basic Paxos.

Three roles in Paxos

  1. Proposers
  2. Acceptor
  3. Learners

General view: Proposers send proposals to Acceptors, Acceptors accept a proposal and forward to Learners, Learners decided the proposal. In real world, a single server acts two or more roles.

Requirements

  1. An acceptor must accept the first proposal that it receives. 1a. An acceptor can accept a proposal numbered n iff it has not responded to a prepare request having a number greater than n.
  2. If a proposal with value v is chosen, then every higher-numbered proposal that is chosen has value v. 2a. If a proposal with value v is chosen, then every higher-numbered proposal accepted by any acceptor has value v. 2b. If a proposal with value v is chosen, then every higher-numbered proposal issued by any proposer has value v. 2c. For any v and n, if a proposal with value v and number n is issued, then there is a set S consisting of a majority of acceptors such that either (a) no acceptor in S has accepted any proposal numbered less than n, or (b) v is the value of the highest-numbered proposal among all proposals numbered less than n accepted by the acceptors in S.

1a is stronger then 1, and 2c => 2b => 2a => 2.

RPCs and Phases

Proposers send two kinds of RPC to majority Acceptors.

  1. Prepare, send with a uniqe proposal number n.
  2. Accept, send with a uniqe proposal number n and proposal value v.

There are two phases in Paxos.

  1. Phase 1: broadcast Prepare RPC
  2. Phase 2: broadcast Accept RPC

Majority is the key to achieve consensus and correctness.

Implementation

Every server play all roles (proposer, acceptor, and learner) in every instance of the algorithm. For a normal operation, there will be a server being elected to act the leader, which is the distinguished proposer (the only one that tries to issue proposals) in all instances of the algorithm.

Pseudo code

Handout of 6.824, Spring 2015 [2]

      --- Paxos Proposer ---

      proposer(v):
        while not decided:
          choose n, unique and higher than any n seen so far
          send prepare(n) to all servers including self
          if prepare_ok(n, na, va) from majority:       --- na and nv is proposal number and value (if any) that acceptor has accepted.
            v' = va with highest na; choose own v otherwise   
            send accept(n, v') to all
            if accept_ok(n) from majority:              --- Paxos Learner ---
              send decided(v') to all


      --- Paxos Acceptor ---

      acceptor state on each node (persistent):
       np     --- highest prepare seen
       na, va --- highest accept seen

      acceptor's prepare(n) handler:
       if n > np
         np = n
         reply prepare_ok(n, na, va)
       else
         reply prepare_reject


      acceptor's accept(n, v) handler:
       if n >= np
         np = n
         na = n
         va = v
         reply accept_ok(n)
       else
         reply accept_reject

Examples

Servers and proposal vaule: S1(X) Prepare: P,1 Accept: A,1,X

E.g. 1

S1(X)    P,1    A,1,X
S2
S3       P,1    A,1,X
                    ^ chosen

X is chosen.

E.g. 2

S1(X)    P,1    A,1,X
S2       P,1    A,1,X    P,3    A,3,X
S3(Y)                    P,3    A,3,X
                    ^ chosen

X is chosen. S2 response P,3 with 1,X, S3 send proposal value X instead of Y.

E.g. 3

S1(X)    P,1    A,1,X
S2       P,1             P,3    A,3,Y    A,1,X(rej)
S3(Y)                    P,3    A,3,Y
                                    ^ chosen

Y is chosen. A,1,X is rejected, because 3 > 1.

E.g. 4

S1(X)    P,1    A,1,X                                  A,3,Y(rej)
S2       P,1             P,3             A,1,X(rej)    A,3,Y
S3(Y)                    P,3    A,3,Y    A,1,X(rej)    
                                                           ^ chosen

Y is chosen. Later, Learner will find out Y is the chosen value, and then send decided(Y) to all servers.

Links

[1]. Lamport, Leslie. “Paxos made simple.” ACM Sigact News 32, no. 4 (2001): 18-25.

[2]. Handout, LEC5, 6.824

[3]. Paxos lecture (Raft user study)

end.

Communications protocol, a defined set of rules and regulations that determine how data is transmitted in telecommunications and computer networking –WIKI#Protocol

ç®€å•çš„æ¥è¯´ï¼Œåè®®æ˜¯è§„èŒƒæ•°æ®ä¼ è¾“çš„ä¸€å¥—è§„åˆ™ã€‚

Finite State Machines (FSM)

ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯æ‘˜è‡ª WIKI çš„å¯¹æœ‰é™çŠ¶æ€æœºçš„è¯´æ˜ï¼š

It is conceived as an abstract machine that can be in one of a finite number of states. The machine is in only one state at a time; the state it is in at any given time is called the current state. It can change from one state to another when initiated by a triggering event or condition; this is called a transition. A particular FSM is defined by a list of its states, and the triggering condition for each transition. –WIKI#FSM

item.title: Goto ä¸æ‹“æ‰‘æ’åº
item.description:
goto in C

gotoåœ¨Cè¯­è¨€ä¸­å¯ä»¥å®ç°æ— é™åˆ¶è·³è½¬ï¼Œç°åœ¨æœ‰å¾ˆå¤šäººéƒ½å»ºè®®åœ¨å®é™…ç¼–ç¨‹ä¸­ä½¿ç”¨å®ƒï¼Œå› ä¸ºå®ƒä¼šä½¿ç¨‹åºçš„æ§åˆ¶æµç¨‹(control flow)å˜å¾—æ··ä¹±ï¼Œéš¾ä»¥é˜…è¯»ã€‚

goto, break, continue

goto,break,continue ä¸‰è€…éƒ½å¯ä»¥æ‰“æ–­æ§åˆ¶æµç¨‹ï¼Œä½†åä¸¤è€…éƒ½æ˜¯æœ‰é™åˆ¶çš„ï¼Œåªèƒ½æ‰“æ–­å½“å‰çš„{}(scope)ã€‚

continue åªèƒ½å†™åœ¨loopé‡Œï¼Œä¸ç„¶ç¼–è¯‘æŠ¥ï¼šcontinue statement not within loopï¼Œ

break åªèƒ½å†™åœ¨loopæˆ–è€…switchä¸­ï¼Œä¸ç„¶ç¼–è¯‘æŠ¥ï¼šbreak statement not within loop or switchã€‚

goto åˆ™ä¸åŒï¼Œå®ƒå¯å†™åœ¨å’Œè·³è½¬åˆ°å‡½æ•°çš„ä»»æ„è¡Œï¼Œè‡ªç”±åº¦æå¤§ï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªä¸å°å¿ƒå°±ä¼šæœ‰bugï¼Œè¿™æ ·çš„ä»£ç é€šå¸¸ä¹Ÿéš¾ä»¥ç»´æŠ¤ã€‚ä¸è¿‡,ç”¨çš„å¥½å½“ç„¶ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥å¢åŠ æ•ˆç‡çš„åŒæ—¶æé«˜å¯è¯»æ€§ã€‚

I think goto’s are fine, and they are often more readable than large amounts of indentation. That’s especially true if the code flow isn’t actually naturally indented (in this case it is, so I don’t think using goto is in any way clearer than not, but in general goto’s can be quite good for readability). —Linus

æ‹“æ‰‘æ’åº

ã€Šç®—æ³•å¯¼è®ºã€‹ä¸­æ‹“æ‰‘æ’åºçš„ä¾‹å­ï¼Œç²‰è‰²çš„æ˜¯å„ç‰©ä»¶çš„ä¾èµ–å›¾ï¼Œé’è‰²çš„æ˜¯æ‹“æ‰‘æ’åºå›¾ã€‚ æ ¹æ®å›¾ï¼Œå¦‚æœè¿˜æ²¡ç©¿å†…è£¤ï¼Œæ‹¿å°±å¿…é¡»è¦ç©¿å†…è£¤é‚£ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹å¼€å§‹èµ°èµ·ï¼›å¦‚æœå·²ç»ç©¿å¥½å†…è£¤å’Œè£¤å­äº†ï¼Œé‚£ä»è…°å¸¦å¼€å§‹èµ°èµ·ä¾¿å¯ã€‚ å¯ä»¥çœ‹å‡ºï¼Œæ‹“æ‰‘æ’åºå›¾ä¸­çš„å„ç‰©ä»¶çš„ä¾èµ–å…³ç³»ä¸ç®­å¤´ç›¸åï¼Œä¸ç®¡ä»å“ªç‚¹è¿›å…¥ï¼Œæœ€ç»ˆçš„è¿˜æ˜¯ä¼šåˆ°åŒä¸€ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ã€‚

å†…å­˜ç®¡ç†å¼•å‘çš„æ€è€ƒ

åœ¨JOSçš„å†…å­˜ç®¡ç†æ¨¡å—ä¸­ï¼Œæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªpage_insertçš„å‡½æ•°ï¼Œå®ƒè´Ÿè´£è®°å½•pageçš„åœ°å€å’Œæƒé™ï¼Œè¿™ä¸ªå‡½æ•°æœ€ç»ˆçš„ç»“æœåªæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªï¼Œä½†è¾“å…¥æœ‰å¤šç§æƒ…å†µï¼Œä¸ºäº†å¤„ç†è¿™äº›æƒ…å†µï¼ŒåŠ¿å¿…è¦å†™å¤šä¸ªåˆ¤æ–­ã€‚ æ’å…¥çš„pagetableä¸­å¯¹åº”è¯¥pageçš„æ¡ç›®æ˜¯å¦æœ‰æ—§çºªå½•ï¼Ÿå¦‚æœæ²¡æœ‰ç›´æ¥æ’å…¥ï¼Œè®¾ç½®æƒé™ï¼Œç»“æŸï¼›å¦‚æœæœ‰ï¼Œæ˜¯å¦åŒä¸€ä¸ªpageï¼Œå¦‚æœåŒä¸€ä¸ªï¼Œè®¾ç½®æ–°æƒé™ï¼Œç»“æŸï¼›å¦‚æœä¸æ˜¯åŒä¸€ä¸ªï¼Œåˆ æ‰æ—§è®°å½•ï¼Œæ’å…¥è¯¥pageåœ°å€ï¼Œè®¾ç½®æƒé™ï¼Œç»“æŸã€‚ å¤§è‡´çš„é€»è¾‘è¯·çœ‹ä¸‹å›¾ï¼š

ä»æè¿°å¯çŸ¥ï¼Œåªæœ‰æ¡ä»¶è·³è½¬æ¥å¤„ç†è¿™äº›æƒ…å†µä¼šæœ‰è®¸å¤šé‡å¤çš„ä»£ç ï¼Œè€Œä¸”ä¸ç›´è§‚ï¼Œéš¾ä»¥ç†è§£ã€‚

ä¸ç”¨gotoçš„page_insert

æ— gotoï¼Œä½†ä»£ç é‡å¤ï¼Œåˆ¤æ–­å±‚çº§è¿‡å¤šï¼Œä¸æ˜“ç†è§£ã€‚

int page_insert(pde_t *pgdir, struct PageInfo *pp, void *va, int perm) {
	pte_t *va_pte = pgdir_walk(pgdir, va, 1);
	if (! va_pte)
		// E_NO_MEM, if page table couldn't be allocated
		return -E_NO_MEM;

	physaddr_t pp_pa = page2pa(pp);

	if ((*va_pte) & PTE_P) {
		// There is something in this pte.
		if (PTE_ADDR(*va_pte) == pp_pa) {
			// Re-insert
			*va_pte = pp_pa | perm | PTE_P;
			if (perm | PTE_U)
				// Changes to User Table
				pgdir[PDX(va)] |= PTE_U;
			return 0;
		}
		// Different page
		page_remove(pgdir, va);
	}

	// Nothing in this PTE
	*va_pte = pp_pa | perm | PTE_P;
	if (perm | PTE_U)
		// Changes to User Table
		pgdir[PDX(va)] |= PTE_U;

	pp->pp_ref += 1;

	return 0;
}

ä½¿ç”¨gotoçš„page_insert

æœ‰gotoï¼Œä½†ä»£ç ä¸é‡å¤ï¼Œè·³è½¬å±‚çº§å°‘ï¼Œç›´è§‚ã€‚

int page_insert(pde_t *pgdir, struct PageInfo *pp, void *va, int perm) {
	pte_t *va_pte = pgdir_walk(pgdir, va, 1);
	if (! va_pte)
		// E_NO_MEM, if page table couldn't be allocated
		return -E_NO_MEM;

	physaddr_t pp_pa = page2pa(pp);

	if (! (*va_pte) & PTE_P)
		// Nothing in this PTE
		goto nonpresent;

	// There is something in this pte.
	if (PTE_ADDR(*va_pte) == pp_pa)
		// Re-insert
		goto present_same;
	else
		// Different page
		goto present_different;

	present_different:
		page_remove(pgdir, va);

	nonpresent:
		*va_pte = pp_pa;
		pp->pp_ref += 1;
		tlb_invalidate(pgdir, va);

	present_same:
		*va_pte = pp_pa | perm | PTE_P;
		if (perm & PTE_U)
			// Commits to User Table
			pgdir[PDX(va)] |= PTE_U;
		if (perm & PTE_W)
			pgdir[PDX(va)] |= PTE_W;

	return 0;
}

æ€»ç»“

  • gotoæœ€å¥½ä¸åˆ¤æ–­å†™åœ¨ä¸€èµ·ï¼Œæ–¹ä¾¿ä»è¯­æ„ç†è§£æ­¤è¯­å¥ã€‚
  • å¦‚æœå‡ºå£åªæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªï¼Œè¿›å£æœ‰å¤šä¸ªï¼Œå¯é€‚å½“ç”¨gotoï¼Œç¬¦åˆDRYã€‚

Another fancy case

// error handler
swith(i) {
    case 1:
        foo();
        break;
    case 2:
        bar();
        break;
    case 3:
        n = dosth_1();
        if (n)
            goto bad;
        n = dosth_2();
        if (n)
            goto bad:
        break;

    default:
    bad:
        report();
        end_this();
        break;
}
